output_list.reason: The mintToken function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.
The setPrices function has a global random variable, which is bad practice and can be a source of unneeded complexity.
The sell function has an integer overflow where the amount is calculated as the balance times the sell price, which can be a potential.user.value trap.
The buy function has an integer overflow where the amount is calculated as the balance times the buy price, which can be a potential.user.value trap.
